reviews.text: Beautiful anytime of day - sunrise is awesome. Easy to access from parking area. One of the most popular spots for photography.
It's a bit of a walk but an easy one to do. We had three kids under 10 with us who made it fine.
Pleasant and very short trail (less than 15min) in to the Mesa Arch, well worth the work. Enjoyed the vegetation along the sandy route as well
It was amazing! Great views through the arch at several different angles! Takes about 10 minutes each way to walk for an average person. A must see!
The best places I've met to see the sun rise. You will shock by the landscape through the arches, and know exactly what the canyonlands this name's meaning.
This may be one of the highlights of my life.  Long strenuous hike. PAY ATTENTION to the cairns and the signs. Easy to go the wrong way. But its INCREDIBLE.
Amazing hike. Do your research before going; have a map and bring water.
It was an amazing hike with tons of sights.
Spectacular!

This is an impressive hike up Elephant Canyon with a beautiful Druid Arch as the prize at the end.  The whole hike is beautiful.  The final 30 minutes are a scramble up the slope with no Arch in sight, and then all of a sudden it looms before you. 

In May there were some pools of water in the canyon bottom near the Arch, suitable for drinking (with filtration). 

This is a great day hike from the Elephant Hill trail head, and also from the backpacking campsites in the area such as Chesler Park.
One of the best day hikes I've done! 26km trail. Beautiful landscape
Absolutely beautiful hike.  A relatively hard to reach hidden gem.
Beautiful hike. One of the best ones we did in Canyonlands
Many people do not know such a hidden treasure here!

It's a gorgeous national park with a lot of different areas to explore. Even when the park is busy and the most popular sections are crowded you can find quiet areas away from other visitors. The road signs and trail guides were also very informative

Wow wow wow! What an experience. Put on sun screen, hat and sunglasses. Bring water and maybe a snack (but leave no waste behind) and a camera because you’ll want to show what you’re about to see! This is so beautiful. You can spend hours here or limit your time (I’m sure you’ll want to do the first).

Amazing views that rival the Grand Canyon.  Be careful with small children, as there are several areas without guard rails.  We look forward to the possibility of traveling their off-road trail in the future.

Great park! Awesome sights, hikes. Upheaval dome hike is not to be missed. Lots of archaeological sites too - but you need more time. Needs at least 4-5 days for the island in the sky part of the park.
Fantastic, non hikers due to age and physical medical problems.  Still able to visit 90% of named sites. Pictures do not do justice.
